results.title: Scenic area attractiveness in Dali City and its influencing factors evaluated using multi-source spatiotemporal data
results.summary: This article evaluates scenic area attractiveness in Dali City using multi-source spatiotemporal data. It covers spatial distribution patterns, sentiment analyses, characteristics of urban scenic areas, spatiotemporal distribution of tourists, and tourist evaluation models based on various user-generated content and mobile data.
results.usefulness_reason: Score 50 assigned because the article discusses 'spatiotemporal data' and uses 'multi-source data' which aligns with 'Contextual dataset' and 'Survey data' in a broad sense. However, it does not explicitly focus on 'Point Process' or 'Spatio Temporal Point Process', making it tangentially relevant rather than directly focused on all aspects of the query.

results.title: Point-process modeling of secondary crashes | PLOS One
results.summary: This article discusses point-process modeling of secondary crashes, using a temporal point-process model with a sinusoidal background rate to classify crash events into primary and secondary events based on queue time values.
results.usefulness_reason: Score 95 assigned because the post is directly and substantially about 'Point Process' and 'Spatio Temporal' (implied by crash events occurring in space and time). It provides a clear application of point-process modeling.

results.title: On the stability and dynamics of stochastic spiking neuron models
results.summary: This article discusses Point Process Generalized Linear Models (PP-GLMs) as a statistical framework for modeling spiking activity in single neurons.
results.usefulness_reason: Score 80 assigned because the post is highly relevant to 'Point Process' by discussing Point Process Generalized Linear Models. However, it does not directly address 'Survey data'.
